effect.frostedresearch.generator_T1.effe: Reinforced with copper plates to make it last longer
effect.frostedresearch.generator_T2.effe: This steam-powered Generator does more than just heat up the environment,
it can also provide plenty of pressured steam for your factory
research.frostedresearch.advanced_geolog: These prospecting tools can help you discover more resources.
To find ore veins more efficiently, you will need a prospecting tool.
research.frostedresearch.alloy_kiln.desc: The Alloy Kiln can produce metal alloy faster and more efficiently.
I've had enough of slow pit kilns, I need a proper dedicated device to produce metal alloy.
research.frostedresearch.alloy_kiln.name: Improved Alloy Smelting
research.frostedresearch.animal_cage.des: I made a cage and furnished its interior with some lining to keep it warm. Great way to transport small animals and cubs, safe and sound!
It may require some labor and some extra care to transport animals through long distance. I have to prevent them from running away, as well as keep them from being fronzen to death.
research.frostedresearch.animal_cage.nam: As Snug as a Cub in a...Cage?
Given enough power, this extensible crafter can perform three recorded crafting recipes in sequence.
research.frostedresearch.assembler.desc_: I've always dreamt of a machine that could do the crafting for me...
research.frostedresearch.assembler.name: Empowered Crafting
research.frostedresearch.assembly_line.d: By forming an assembly line of devices, I can easily automate the tedious series of steps to assemble a more complicated part or gadget.
I've noticed that many complicated products are assembled step-by-step, I'll need an assembly line to do this more efficiently...
Now I can automate the crafting of some items that previously had to be made by hand.
After building the Automatic Workbench, I think the Engineer's Assembly Table can be automated too.
research.frostedresearch.banner.desc.1: You should not be looking at this
research.frostedresearch.banner.name: You should not be looking at this
research.frostedresearch.better_fluid_tr: These devices can move liquids to wherever I want!
To move liquids around efficiently, I need a better understanding of their mechanics.
This industrial-grade Mixer is powerful enough to handle any (rational) recipe.
research.frostedresearch.big_mixer.desc_: The current combination of the Mechanical Mixer and Basin can no longer satisfy my growing needs, I need something more robust...
research.frostedresearch.big_mixer.name: Will It Blend?
research.frostedresearch.blast_furnace.d: This simple Blast Furnace is sturdy and durable enough to melt most of the minerals I can find.
To melt minerals faster, I need a durable Blast Furnace.
research.frostedresearch.blast_furnace_u: This industrial-grade Blast Furnace is capable of working with automated equipment to melt minerals more efficiently.
I have found that automation is important to the operation of the plant, improving the Blast Furnace is a good choice.
research.frostedresearch.bottling_machin: At last, I’ve built a machine that can precisely bottle chemicals without worrying about any leaks.
I’ve created many chemicals, but I still need to apply them in production.
So I’ll need a machine to infuse items with chemicals—without dirtying my own hands.
research.frostedresearch.car_kiln.desc.0: I've designed a large industrial-grade Car Kiln capable of processing both solid and liquid material.
research.frostedresearch.car_kiln.desc_a: Time for something better than my good old Beehive Oven.
research.frostedresearch.car_kiln.name: Sintering
research.frostedresearch.changing_mask.d: I've noticed some refugees are starting to avoid me. It seems word of some of my past deeds has begun to spread among them. But should I stoop low and give them gifts to mend our relationship? Maybe I could disguise myself—make them unable to recognize me—so they forget my crimes when we trade.
It worked. But if I hide my sins behind a mask... how much will the real me rot away?
research.frostedresearch.chemical_reacto: Chemistry changes life, but a simple mixer can’t handle gases and leads to waste.
Why not build a machine specifically for chemical synthesis? It could greatly improve resource efficiency.
A dedicated device to produce coke, charcoal and creosote oil. Much more efficent than a Charcoal Pit.
research.frostedresearch.coke_oven.desc_: I've been using primitive pits for coke and charcoal production that are so tedious to operate and produce little creosote oil, maybe I can improve on this?
research.frostedresearch.coke_oven.name: Refining Coal
research.frostedresearch.create_structur: I can now make full use of my imagination to build moving structures!
It would be pretty cool if I could move large structures of blocks around but there are still several problems to solve...
research.frostedresearch.crucible.desc.0: The Steel Mill Crucible turns iron into steel by adjusting its carbon content. This stronger and tougher new material can be used in all aspects of our industry!
research.frostedresearch.crucible.desc_a: I happened to get a piece of black metal from a failed Iron Crucible. It's even tougher than iron!
research.frostedresearch.crucible.name: Better Than Iron?!?
research.frostedresearch.crusher.desc.0: Surprisingly simple—just brute force does the trick.
research.frostedresearch.crusher.desc_al: It’s just replacing the crushing wheel with a motor—it won’t take long.
research.frostedresearch.crusher.name: Electric Crushing
This grinding device can crush ore more efficiently.
It's not so efficient to smelt entire ore blocks. Maybe I should break them down into dust?
(Tip: If all clues are completed but you still need Tech Points, you would have to build a Mechanical Calculator to assist you in computing the rest of the Tech Points.)
research.frostedresearch.electrolyzer.de: To smelt reactive metals, such as Aluminum, traditional thermal-reduction methods won't work. Electrolysis is the proper method for this task.
I've noticed that some ore types simply disappear when I try to smelt them directly. Maybe I should try some more subtle way to deal with them?
research.frostedresearch.electromagnetic: These generators can turn rotational energy into electricity!
Some sparks appeared when I moved a magnet inside a coil! Maybe I can use this discovery to produce electricity?
(Tip: If all clues are completed but you still need Tech Points, you would have to build a Mechanical Calculator to assist you in computing the rest of the Tech Points.)
research.frostedresearch.electron_tube.d: Although there's still a long way to go before I can build a working computer, these simple logic elements are a step towards progress.
I miss the feel of having all that low-level stuff taken care of by the on-board computer. Alas, I'll have to rebuild from the ground-up...
research.frostedresearch.enchantment_tab: The underlying principals still confuse me, but now I can use Lapis in the Enchanting Table to greatly improve my gear!
Lapis Lazuli seems to have mysterious effect on my tools...maybe I can exploit this to improve them?
I've successfully identified several species of bacteria I can use for different types of fermentation. I wonder what else I can use this might be useful for?
research.frostedresearch.fermenter.desc_: I've found that some liquids change states under certain temperatures, why is that?
research.frostedresearch.fermenter.name: Fermentation
research.frostedresearch.fluid_transport: Nice, these pipes are strong and durable.
Using buckets to transport all these liquids is becoming tedious, maybe I can create some kind of closed pipe to move them around?
research.frostedresearch.gain_experience: I can do some self reflection and get knowledge.
research.frostedresearch.generator_T1.de: The Generator will not only warm me up like campfire did, but also warm up the surrounding area! Maybe now I can grow some cold-resistent crops?
Ponder with the Engery Core to get instructions on how to build it.
I managed to remove the energy core of the space shuttle in one piece, maybe I can repair it?
Its original energy supply is depleted, maybe I can find another way to power it?
If everything goes well, maybe I can use it to heat the base?
research.frostedresearch.generator_T2.de: This more advanced version of the Generator can heat up a larger area as well as provide high-pressure steam. Maybe I can make a steam network?
I'm quite familiar with steam. Maybe I can use it to power the Energy Core?
research.frostedresearch.generator_effic: With new burner and bellows, generators can burn more efficiently now.
As my knowledge extends, I find that better ventilation as long as better burner can improve burning efficiency.
With better insulation, generators can burn more efficiently now.
Generator is like some kind of bigger kiln, why not use the insulation technique from kilns on generators?
research.frostedresearch.generator_heat_: With improved boiler, generators can generate more energy.
An idea goes into my mind just after I finished the designed of steam turbine. Why not install better boilers to improve energy generation of the generator without extra fuel cost?
research.frostedresearch.generator_regai: I accidentally lose my energy core in the frosted land. Maybe I can recall my memory to find it.
&c&lA team can only build one generator, claim repeatly is pointless.
research.frostedresearch.geology_underst: The location of strata clearly follows a pattern, and the location of ore veins seems to be strongly associated with the surrounding stratum. Finding ores should be much easier now!
I've been hunting for ore veins aimlessly. There must be some way to more easily locate them...maybe it's time for a field trip?
research.frostedresearch.hand_warmer.des: I've carefully designed a Hand Stove, with it I can keep fuel smoldering as a safe and handy portable heat source.
Carrying around a lit campfire might not be a good idea...I wonder if I can make something warm to hold?
With steam incubator, growing fungis is a lot easier.
Using quicklime to power incubators is a bit expensive. Maybe I can heat it up with heat.
research.frostedresearch.heating_basin.d: I've figured out how to provide heat while mixing, it's as simple as placing a heat source under the Basin.
Sometimes heat is required to achieve various reactions. Maybe I can heat the Basin directly?
(Tip: If all clues are completed but you still need Tech Points, you would have to build a Mechanical Calculator to assist you in computing the rest of the Tech Points.)
research.frostedresearch.heating_vest.de: I should place the vest in the Curios back slot so it doesn't take damage like my armor. It provides good warmth even in the harshest of conditions, I just have to keep it full of steam.
What is the ultimate way to keep yourself warm, even in the middle of a terrible blizzard? Hmmmm, WEARING STEAM?
research.frostedresearch.heavy_engineeri: To build heavy machinery, I’ll need stronger, cold-resistant materials.
Through some practice, I gain some tricks on writing papers.
I have a problem with my lack of inspiration. Maybe it is worth spending some time improving my abilities.
With this device, I can grow fungis easier.
Although I would require a lot of quicklime to power it up.
research.frostedresearch.incubator.desc_: Though taking a mushroom bed with me is convenient, it occupies my inventory.
I need a stationary mushroom incubator.
research.frostedresearch.incubator.name: Fungis incubation
research.frostedresearch.industrial_elec: With the ability to craft graphite electrodes we can build a better electrolyzer.
Graphite is an ideal material for electrodes: great electrical conductivity, good heat resistance, and it doesn't oxidize all that easily.
research.frostedresearch.iron.desc.0: A bloomery! That's what I needed to perform the reaction. Here it is, IRON! Now I'm feeling civilized!
research.frostedresearch.iron.desc_alt.0: I remember that it requires heat and a reductive chemical to produce iron from its oxide. Though it may be much harder to put it to practice.
research.frostedresearch.iron.name: Acquiring Hardware
Lining my armor will cause both to loose durability when I take damage, hopefully this is a temporary solution.
Having to choose between warmth and protection in such a hostile environment is rather scary, what else could I do?
research.frostedresearch.mechanical_bell: Well that's disappointing...Redstone can't even provide the initial startup stress of 1su. I'll need to find another solution...
Decreasing manual labor is essential to forwards progress and I need to find a source of reliable initial stress for the Bellows, maybe Redstone will do the trick?
research.frostedresearch.mechanical_calc: A small calculator, though rough, but now it's no longer ncessary to always stay around the drawing desk anyway. Wait... wrong again? Now I need to stay around the calculator so? Takes me so long time to configure this calculator. Maybe not that inspiration-consuming, but consuming power is for real. What? Deployer? That thing is good as long as it does not add more trouble. It will only make wrong data chaotic and useless...

Dead end, dead end, dead end, all dead ends... Standing on the shoulder of a giant maybe won't have a further view, but possibly fall harder. If there are some device that can help me with this inspiration-consuming research process... Nevermind, that is something unsolved even when science is at the peak. But there should be some method to save my some power...
research.frostedresearch.mechanical_craf: Mechanical crafter, using stress to assemble raw materials in certain patterns. Great, but consuming too much stress, not suitable for a automation. Maybe only a crafting center for larger machines.

Workbench is just that big. But bigger is useless for me... I can't manage to use it. If there are something that can perform some crafting procedure automatically it would be great. So that I can try to build some complex structures.
research.frostedresearch.mechanical_pres: Converting rotation into pressure impact, that's effectively solves rolling problem. So I name it a rolling machine. But, even it increases material efficiency, some corner materials are still lost. Cold metal technique should not end at this point.

Hammering iron on a piece of log (why it doesn't break?) is not a good metal processing technique. After all the priority is to free my hands? Why don't I try to use other power to help processing my metal?
I designed a circular saw blade and installed it onto a table. Now just by moving the object accross the spinning saw blade, I can make whatever I want. Perfect!

Processing logs manually is troublesome and actually requires some...craftsmanship. I did a terrible job: if I use the axe, sometimes I can only produce awful products which maybe only used as fuel; if I use the saw, it will cost more time that I can accept...
research.frostedresearch.mechanics_measu: Gauge is a good strategy to check mistakes. But for now, we need to test speed and stress. I hope these two can keep our stress network working. Only hope though.
Rotate, rotate, rotate, yes great, it rotates... what why it stops again? Reset! What, why the cogwheel breaks... I need something to help me check what's wrong!
research.frostedresearch.mechanics_tools: Wrench is a nice tool. It effectively let me adjust the direction of devices, saving me a lot of time. Googles present primary information about current devices. At least I can research problems in my designs.
Got it reversed again!!! If there is a tool to precisely adjust the current devices without replacing them, that would be super.
research.frostedresearch.metal_press.des: I believe this is the best design under current cold technique. Though it's slower, but I can not only make plates,, I can even make wires, rods, and even casings with similar design. But if I want to increase the efficiency further to prevent breakage, hot processing is a must.

The rolling machine is a good cold metal processing device. But because of its instatbility it mostly cost waste in material. If we somehow fix the material and use mold to control it, we may increase the efficiency of metal processing.
Using rotational force to grind items down is exhausting but it's the best method I have at the moment...
research.frostedresearch.millstone.desc_: Manually grinding materials doesn't yield as much as I'd hoped, maybe I can automate this in some way?
research.frostedresearch.millstone.name: Grinding
research.frostedresearch.mixer.desc.0: Mixing egg, well, good, but that's it. Mixing is mostly even, but looking for real homogenity is nonsense. I need to find a better machine to process this.
Combined material is something I have always been looking for, but the necessary process it to mix them together. The most common ways needs high temperature, water, etc. OK those methods are not I can test now. I just want to get some bricks, maybe egg mixer is a good choice.
research.frostedresearch.mixer.name: Mixing
research.frostedresearch.multiblock_stru: Now I can start building large machines using these standard structural elements!
I need larger machines to upscale production...
research.frostedresearch.precision_mecha: Well it succeeds, using electric tubes to control transmission devices is truly possible. But, this price, is just too unbearable. If there are some cheaper way of signal control that would be better. After all redstone's power is too small. Changing speed is my creative limit.

For some mchines only cogwheels cannot satisfy my requirements. I need more precision structures. But smaller cogwheels are hard to craft. But if we use redstone signal to replace the precision given by the cogwheels?
research.frostedresearch.propaganda.desc: As I murdered a lot, my notoriety speard across the frosted land. I need to build up a monument for the victim and bribe some people to promote me.
research.frostedresearch.propaganda.name: Beneficial Propaganda
research.frostedresearch.rescue_plan_ini: I think I can prepare some supplies for the villagers—maybe they’ll view me more favorably.
research.frostedresearch.rotary_kiln.des: The Rotary Kiln is great for firing large batches. It even collects all the liquids produced from processing!
My current demand for charcoal far exceeds the current production method...I wonder if I can improve on it using some kind of long heated cylindrical vessel rotating on an incline?
research.frostedresearch.rubbing_tool.de: With rubbing tool, I can make machines without intelligent operate and record data from mechanical calculators.
I am somehow tired of operating and recording data from mechanical calculator on my own.
(Tip: If all clues are completed but you still need Tech Points, you would have to build a Mechanical Calculator to assist you in computing the rest of the Tech Points.)
research.frostedresearch.sauna_vent.desc: Now that I can make enclosed room and fill with steam to improve my body.
I already learnt that heat can be trasferred from steam, but what about directly touch with steam?
research.frostedresearch.sauna_vent.name: Sauna Reliability
research.frostedresearch.sawmill.name: Electric Lumber Processing
research.frostedresearch.simple_machines: The Mill and Press are great machines, but only for rotation. For our system it is still a little lacking. If the rotational power can be changed to other types of power it would be better.
When rotation transmission is no longer a problem, I should also consider adding those rotation machiens into my stress system.
research.frostedresearch.soil_thermomete: It fails, such a pity. The small temperature increment brought by warm weather cannot keep these crops to grow. Maybe when they are grown I will also be successfully starved to death.
This strange climate makes it hard to determine when to plant crops. Only eating fish is obviously not enough to keep up my necessary nutrition. I need to find a way to fight the weather.
research.frostedresearch.squeezer.desc.0: Well it succeeds? If I don't consider that huge energy loss, I would really like to use contraptions. But now I don't have that much stress power. I can only accumulate electricity and provide it to machines, so it can provide huge squeezing power. But the consumption is still too high. If the squeezed stuff are not necessary I would really not like to use it.
research.frostedresearch.squeezer.desc_a: In order to extract some liquids from plants I tried to use the mill and crushing wheels to squeeze them. But except breaking their shelss I cannot get further results. Hence I try to use larger machiens for better extraction technique.
research.frostedresearch.squeezer.name: Industrial Squeezer
research.frostedresearch.steam_heater.de: Spreading heat through steam radiation, I can build some pseudo-Generators. But the consumption is much greater than the chargers. Maybe it is the time to research the next generation of Generator. But, I don't have any better heating methods now anyway...

From the people, to the people. Maybe steam charger is a good way to consume heat. Yet, my real interest for building a Generator is not cooking food or making a heating vest. I actually want to have better agricultural and husbandry regions. If I can use these heat to make some 'pseudo-Generators' that would be really great..
research.frostedresearch.steam_powerd.de: Currently, steam engines are great at producing needed stress. Larger steam engines are possible, but I don't have that much heat to power it. Now I've got a basic engine. It suffices for my current needs.

Boiling water is the most essential exemplification of human civilization. It is also the important foundation of transforming religious workship to scientific research. But how to boil water to better provide power is a complex and serious question.
research.frostedresearch.steam_turbine.d: If I combine stress device and electricity generation deivice, I can save the loss from transmission. Meanwhile, because the stress device is within the electric generation device, I can use a better structure to greatly reduce power consumption while producing higher voltage. But the steam boilers are anyway finite sources. New stress machines or larger boilers are urgently needed to consider.

Transforming rotational energy to electric energy can convert energy that are not possible to store into energy that can be stored. But, a severe problem is, the current efficiency is too low. If I can increase the efficiency I can reduce my reliance on fuel.
research.frostedresearch.stering_generat: Maybe I can use high-pressure steam generated by the Steam Generator to generate rotational power.
Since it is small in size and powerful in use, I decide to call it "steam core"
Under reasonable research, wooden barrel is necessarily a storage device for me. It has same storage as a chest but needs a bronze plate to keep it in place.

For now, crafting a chest is far for me. But my sutff won't fit in inventory and stone chests anymore. Now I need a device that does not require workbench to craft to store my stuff. Could it be possible?
research.frostedresearch.storage_drawers: Compacting drawers are nice and all but it would be nice to have something to manage them. Out of sight, out of mind.
Simply compressing materials into blocks is not enough to make up for my lack of storage space. I wonder if I can compress them further?
research.frostedresearch.tetra.desc.0: A workbench dedicated to improving my tools, maybe now I can mine harder blocks with my bronze pickaxe.
Normal tools aren't enough, I need to try and develop a better tool crafting && improvement method.
research.frostedresearch.tetra.name: Sharpen Your Tools!
research.frostedresearch.thermos_T1.desc: Crafting a thermos can keep water warm for a decent amount of time. Anything for a slight advantage in this frostbitten wasteland...
Using these wooden cups isn't very sensible...it would be nice to have a larger version that didn't take as much inventory space.
research.frostedresearch.thermos_T1.name: Thermos
research.frostedresearch.thermos_T2.desc: This metallic upgraded thermos is twice the size of the original.
I need to explore further to find what I need but I'm still limited by how much water the thermos can hold.
research.frostedresearch.thermos_T2.name: Improved Thermos
research.frostedresearch.transmission_ma: Whew, rotating everything manually is exhausting...I need to find a better way to do this.
Rotational force is undoubtedly the best method to trasmit stress. Maybe I can distribute the force more evenly and do two things at once?
research.frostedresearch.villager_langua: After spending some time with the refugees, I found they come from all over the world, speaking many languages. I might not become fluent in all of them, but if I study basic grammar and vocabulary and practice speaking, I think I can build good relationships—and profit in trade.
research.frostedresearch.wool_armor.desc: Wool seems to be the best option available at the moment, I'll have to find a way to domesticate sheep.
A snowstorm is approaching and this primitive clothing won't hold up for very long...I need to find more warm clothing options.
research.frostedresearch.wool_armor.name: Wool Clothes
